metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3621 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel. It has been classified as problematic. Affected is the function nilfs_bmap_lookup_at_level of the file fs/nilfs2/inode.c of the component nilfs2. The manipulation leads to null pointer dereference. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-211920. It was discovered that a null pointer dereference existed in the NILFS2 file system implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-aws package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-signed-aws package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed-azure package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed-gcp package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-signed-kvm package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
